title: B5084.pdf
content:
be correctly labeled 
and kept separately, so that the contents are not mistaken for other fluids. After 
use, the bottles should be returned to the storage place and not left lying around.
Suffocation: 
✱  Plastic bags are the most important cause for suffocation in children. They 
should be kept in a safe place out of reach of children.   
✱  In cold weather, people light a small fire in the room/courtyard at night to keep warm. The fire should be put out before going to sleep.
Drowning:   
✱  Toddlers can drown in a bucket of water, so they should not be left alone near a bucket of water or in the bathroom. The bathroom door should not 
be closed with a baby inside alone.
✱  Young children going to swim should be under adult supervision. An adult 
who knows how to swim, how to rescue a drowning person, and who will 
stay close to the swimming area, should accompany them. Swimming should 
not be allowed in rivers or the sea during the rainy season.
